III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The group home is located several blocks west of downtown Howell and about a
block south of Grand River Ave. Swann Court is a gravel road on a court accessible
from Grand River Ave. The neighborhood is a mixture of residential and commercial
sites. Most of the homes appear to be older, modest, single family dwellings.
The facility is a ranch style, wood-frame house with a front porch. It has aluminum
siding and an unfinished basement. It is 1300 sq. ft dwelling with two bedrooms and
an unattached 1-car garage.
The house has sufficient space for housing 6 children, a staff office and storage for
records and supplies. The girl’s bedroom is suitable for 4 residents and the square
footage, per resident, exceeds the rule requirement. Also, the square footage for the
two-person boy’s room exceeds the rule requirement.
Please refer to the attachments including an Excessive Concentration study.
B. Program Description
The parent agency, the Livingston Family Center, is a community based non-profit
agency offering out- patient counseling service and educational programs to
residents of Livingston County. From 2001 to present, the agency has provided
shelter services to runaway youth using licensed foster homes in the county.
The agency’s program statement reflects that the Connection Shelter will offer
temporary shelter for youth in a community based facility along with individual and
family counseling, case management/supportive services, 24-hour crisis intervention
2

and referral services, food, clothing, medical services, recreational, educational and
vocational and group counseling, time limited outpatient and aftercare services,
community education and prevention services.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
Based on a review of the agency’s plans to achieve compliance with applicable rules
and statutes, it has been determined that the agency’s submitted plans are
acceptable.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend issuance of a provisional license to the Connection Shelter.
